guide.introduction: This is a step-by-step guide on how to create electrolysis using homemade solar cells.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This is a step-by-step guide on how to create electrolysis using homemade solar cells.

Relevant parts
  • Copper or brass foil, 36 gauge (0.005") or thinner, 1" wide, 6" long
  • Wire, solid copper, insulated, 18–20 gauge
  • electrodes
  • CD case
  • 9V battery
  • Salt water
  • Sunlight
Tools
  • Glue gun
  • Mini Volt Meter (ID: 460 from Adafruit Industries NOTE: These operate from +3.2V to +30V DC and are powered by the supply being measured)
  • Soldering iron
  • Stove
  • Wire cutter/stripper

parts.text: Copper or brass foil, 36 gauge (0.005") or thinner, 1" wide, 6" long

lines.text: Materials are available at most hardware stores.
lines.text_raw: Materials are available at most hardware stores.

lines.text: Cut copper tubing into two 3" rods.
lines.text_raw: Cut copper tubing into two 3" rods.

lines.text: Cut two copper sheets to fit inside the container that will be used as your solar cell.
lines.text_raw: Cut two copper sheets to fit inside the container that will be used as your solar cell.

lines.text: Test your 9V battery to make sure it is fresh.
lines.text_raw: Test your 9V battery to make sure it is fresh.

lines.text: Pour water into your electrolysis container and add salt.
lines.text_raw: Pour water into your electrolysis container and add salt.

lines.text: Connect copper rods to battery and place them in solution to test apparatus. If bubbles appear around copper electrodes then electrolysys is occurring.
lines.text_raw: Connect copper rods to battery and place them in solution to test apparatus. If bubbles appear around copper electrodes then electrolysys is occurring.

lines.text: Be sure to use a properly ventilated room. Open windows and doors to help remove odor as fumes may be noxious. Also, make sure you use caution as the copper will be hot. Make sure the the stove is clean and no flammable materials or liquids are nearby.
lines.text_raw: Be sure to use a properly ventilated room. Open windows and doors to help remove odor as fumes may be noxious. Also, make sure you use caution as the copper will be hot. Make sure the the stove is clean and no flammable materials or liquids are nearby.

lines.text: The glue gun will be hot. Wear protective covering. The glue will be hot so be careful when applying it. Also, make sure you have something non-flammable and flat to rest the glue gun on when putting it down.
lines.text_raw: The glue gun will be hot. Wear protective covering. The glue will be hot so be careful when applying it. Also, make sure you have something non-flammable and flat to rest the glue gun on when putting it down.

lines.text: Check to see if the container leaks. If it does, use additional glue, find another container, or put a zip-lock bag around the container.
lines.text_raw: Check to see if the container leaks. If it does, use additional glue, find another container, or put a zip-lock bag around the container.
